biography.value: Their fur stained with the blood of fallen foes, minotaurs are massive, bull-headed humanoids whose roar is a savage battle cry that all civilized creatures fear.

description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d12 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d8 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Charge. If the minotaur moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra [[/damage 2d8 type=piercing average=true]] damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a [[/save str 14 format=long]] or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Labyrinthine Recall. The minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Reckless. At the start of its turn, the minotaur can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
